task.title: Properties
task.shortdesc: Use Properties editor to edit the appearance and content of the views chosen for a workspace.

indexterm.keyword: Edit the appearance of the views
Edit the content of the views

taskbody.prereq: User account must have necessary permissions to view the Properties editor.

step.stepresult: The Properties editor opens with a list of the views on the left, grouped by type. On the right, the general workspace properties appear.

step.cmd: Select one of the views in the Properties tree.
step.info: All types of views have a Style tab, with different options for the type of view. The table, charts, and topology views have Query and Filters tabs, table and topology have a Thresholds tab, and terminal emulators have a Configuration tab. Whenever you want to change the data elements that display for a chart or table or change the styling of a view, go to the Properties editor.

step.cmd: Click Cancel to close the Properties editor.
